bibl.title: Moy Hing Hun v. Henry M. White. Order to Show Cause
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for Western District of Washington, Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of MOY HING HUN For a Writ of Habeas Corpus.

On reading and the filing of the petition of Moy Hing Hun, duly signed and verified, whereby it appears that the said Moy Hing Hun is wrongfully and unlawfully deprived of his liberty and imprisoned by Hon. Henry M. White, Commissioner of Immigration at Seattle, at the Immigration Station at Seattle, and stating wherein the illegality exists, from which it appears a Writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue:
NOW, THEREFORE, IT IS BY THIS COURT,

Ordered, adjudged and decreed that the said Henry M. White have the body of the said Moy Hing Hun before me in the Court room of this Court on the 17th day of October, 1921. at 10 A.M., of said day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Moy Hing Hun, together with the time and cause of his detention, and that he then and there have this order with him; and it is further ordered that the Clerk of this Court under the Seal thereof cause to be served upon the said Henry M. White a true and correct copy of this order.
Filed in the United States District Court
